strings.Value: "She stood in the way of something I needed."
"She had suffered enough. I spared her from further pain."
"It is none of your concern."
"I won't ruin lives just because I can."
"She was no threat to my plans, and spilling blood needlessly often causes more trouble."
"I have nothing to say to you."
"My name is {name}! Remember it, or I swear, next time we meet will be the last!"
"I have to go."
"My name will be known for centuries — I'm {mf|Baron|Baroness} {name}. Now — who are you and why are you following me?"
"If it is so, why do you keep hounding the steps of this 'lesser race'?"

{n}Before you is the same raven as before. It sits, adjusts itself, then ruffles its feathers a few times as it tries to settle on its perch. Finally, it cocks its head to the side and affixes you with a single eye.{/n} "Why?"
{n}The raven flaps its wings and utters a rattling caw, as if clearing its throat.{/n} "Why kill the Sisterrr? Why walk the path of destrrrruction?"
{n}The raven utters a rattling caw, as if clearing its throat.{/n} "Why sparrrrre the Sisterrrr, when you could rrrid yourself of her? Why let the weak surrrrvive?"
"Ego. Negligence. Uncarrrring of the lives of otherrrrs. Impressive. Your race has learrrned the lessons of the past."
"A wise answerrrr it would be, if not crrrroaked from the throat of a {race}."
"Is that how you rrrationalize yourrr deeds? You may use such weak tales to fool those that fearrrr you, but I do not... I see you for who you arrrre, {race}."
"Is that so? It never stopped you beforrre. Hypocrrrisy… why herrre? Why now?"
{n}The raven shifts on its perch, but remains silent.{/n}
"Off with you, {race}! There are countless like you, many of the lesser rrraces who breed, sufferrrr and die, little more than snuffed candles with no names to be rrrememberrred by."
"So be it…. {name}." {n}The raven spreads its wings and takes flight.{/n}
{n}The raven swivels its head to the side and stares at you with a beady eye.{/n} "You're unworthy to know my masterrrr. You may neverrr know."
{n}With a shrieking caw, the raven spreads its wings and takes flight.{/n}
